Package javacheckers.networking

Class Host

  • java.lang.Object
    • javacheckers.networking.Host
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CheckersHost
    public class Host
extends java.lang.Object
    Defines a host object for connecting with clients and passing messages Designed and adapted from the notes here http://math.hws.edu/javanotes/c12/s5.html

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Host​(int port)
      Create a host listening on the specified port, and start the message processing thread.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      protected void clientConnected​(int clientID)
      Called after a new client has connected
      protected void clientDisconnected​(int clientID)
      Called when a client disconnects
      protected void extraHandshake​(int clientID, java.io.ObjectInputStream in, java.io.ObjectOutputStream out)
      Called after a connection is received to handle extra set up.
      boolean getAutoreset()
      Return the value of the autoreset property
      int[] getClientList()
      Get a list of ID numbers of the clients that are currently connected.
      protected void messageReceived​(int clientID, java.lang.Object message)
      Called when a message is received by a client.
      void resetOutput()
      Reset all output streams after any messages currently in the output queue have been sent.
      void restartServer​(int port)
      Restarts listening and accepting new clients
      void sendToAll​(java.lang.Object message)
      Sends a specified Object as a message to all connected clients.
      boolean sendToOne​(int clientID, java.lang.Object message)
      Sends a specified Object as a message to the client with the specified ID.
      void setAutoreset​(boolean auto)
      If autoreset is set to true, all output streams will be reset before each transmission.
      void shudownHost()
      Disconnect all currently connected clients and stop accepting new clients.
      void shutdownServerSocket()
      Stops listening without dropping connections.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Host

        public Host​(int port)
     throws java.io.IOException
        Create a host listening on the specified port, and start the message processing thread.
        Parameters:
        port - The port to listen on
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if it is not possible to create a listening socket on the specified port

    • Method Detail

      • messageReceived

        protected void messageReceived​(int clientID,
                               java.lang.Object message)
        Called when a message is received by a client.
        Parameters:
        clientID - The ID of the client the message is from
        message - The actual message that was sent

      • clientConnected

        protected void clientConnected​(int clientID)
        Called after a new client has connected
        Parameters:
        clientID - The ID of the new client

      • clientDisconnected

        protected void clientDisconnected​(int clientID)
        Called when a client disconnects
        Parameters:
        clientID - The ID of the client that disconnected

      • extraHandshake

        protected void extraHandshake​(int clientID,
                              java.io.ObjectInputStream in,
                              java.io.ObjectOutputStream out)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Called after a connection is received to handle extra set up.
        Parameters:
        clientID - The id of the client to shake hands with
        in - The stream from which messages from the client can be read
        out - The stream that messages to the client can be sent
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is a problem with the connection. The connection will be closed and the client never added to the list.

      • getClientList

        public int[] getClientList()
        Get a list of ID numbers of the clients that are currently connected.
        Returns:
        An array containing the ID numbers of currently connected clients

      • shutdownServerSocket

        public void shutdownServerSocket()
        Stops listening without dropping connections. Useful if a max number of connections is reached.

      • restartServer

        public void restartServer​(int port)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Restarts listening and accepting new clients
        Parameters:
        port - The port to listen on
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if it is not possible to create a socket on the specified port

      • shudownHost

        public void shudownHost()
        Disconnect all currently connected clients and stop accepting new clients.

      • sendToAll

        public void sendToAll​(java.lang.Object message)
        Sends a specified Object as a message to all connected clients.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to send to all clients. It must implement the Serializable interface and must not be null.

      • sendToOne

        public boolean sendToOne​(int clientID,
                         java.lang.Object message)
        Sends a specified Object as a message to the client with the specified ID.
        Parameters:
        clientID - The ID of the client to send the message to
        message - The message to send to the client. Must implement the serializable interface and must not be null.
        Returns:

      • resetOutput

        public void resetOutput()
        Reset all output streams after any messages currently in the output queue have been sent. Use this if the same object is sent more than once, and some changes have been made to it.

      • setAutoreset

        public void setAutoreset​(boolean auto)
        If autoreset is set to true, all output streams will be reset before each transmission.
        Parameters:
        auto - The value to set autoreset to

      • getAutoreset

        public boolean getAutoreset()
        Return the value of the autoreset property
        Returns:
        The value of the autoreset property
